transcript.content: 01:05 then, already of a Saturday. So I'm Ricky Gervais, that was Placebo, yeah? With 'Special Needs', which brings me to my next point: with me, Karl Pilkinton
Karl Pilkington, there he is.
Steve Merchant, 104.9.
That's it.
We're back, then.
Well, for one last time.

Well, it's certainly the end of the season. We're away for at least two months. We're doing The Office special, and possibly forever. Depending on whether Karl decides he wants to carry on with this. Because, I mean, we do this for fun. We don't need to do this we don't need to do this for, you know, money.
Obviously not
The kind of money you're earning, rick, you do not need to do this
I don't need to do it, it is honestly, beneath me. We don't need to do it to further our career because it's embarrassing being on XFM...
Didn't your accountant say: "Do not even bother cashing those XFM checks, it's not worth your while"?

No, it's not-- the time it took to sign them- It wasn't worth it. So we do this basically to ridicule Karl on a large sort of platform. -I say large platform, well, it's XFM- No other no other radio station will have us.
It's roughly the same as standing up in McDonald's, I imagine.
But over lunchtime, though.
Yeah. Or when it's just the cleaning stuff is mopping up.
Yeah. If Karl doesn't come back, he's breaking up the three way partnership forever.
He's very much like Sting, isn't he?
Yeah. Exactly.
In about what, like 1986-87?
He's going to go off and sort of make some quite poor sort of jazz inflected White Man Soul and leaving us to go about our business.
Play pizza places.
Exactly. While I'm going to go into maybe writing some soundtracks.
Saying like "Dad! Why can't I be in the CIA?" "You don't know anything about it. You're a drummer"
So we'll have to see. I mean, do you think anyone cares?
I wouldn't have thought so. Because I think if someone was interested in having some good chat and some great laughs, they spent more time with their friends.
Or listen to another radio station.
Or listen to a decent radio show, they listen to XFM for some music to have on in the background that's loud enough so they can hear it while they're hoovering.
Yeah. I don't think our fans hoover.
Well, true, true.
Or shoot up, whatever
I think you've got to have a house. To hoover. I tell you what I do want though: Some great music.
Indeed.
They'll be saying 'Since You've Been Gone'. See that? That's the sort of link I can do. If we stay together.
If you could cut out all the other drivel you speak, you'd be great on Magic.
I know, yeah. You've got to-
Come on
I know you've got a rainbow something, haven't you? You've got a rainbow something!
It's Rainbow!
Ricky giggles
Since You've Been Gone by Rainbow fades in
Well, I mean, for our last show, that song had everything.
It's got two guitar solos.
Yes.

It's got a key change. It's got bad grammar, "since you've been gone" by rainbow and that's for Camfield, the Prince of Rock. He's going to be the king when Vance just you know, hands over his crown. And you've still got that on XFM, so you know, don't worry about us going- Oh, you weren't?? Oh, okay then.
Steve laughs
No one cares.
No one cares.
This is our last show, let's make it a good one!
Let me give out the email address because I imagine there's going to be a flood of emails.
Saying "Please, Karl, keep the team together!"
Yes, it's [John-o dot Coleman at -]
Coleman's not a team, he's just a big lad.
Right, come on!
Uhmm, what do you mean, come on? I've got nothing.
Ricky dot Gervais at XFM dot co dot uk, or Karl dot Pilkington, because you can do it throughout the week, you can do it throughout the two months.
And what's the, what's the phone number for XFM? 0207? Is it 7-66-6000? And then just ask people to be put through to Karl and leave a message on his voicemail.
Yeah
So email him a lot. 0-2-0-7-6-6-6000 I think, and just ask for Karl Pilkington
Who cares?
Little 'Karl-uh Pilkingdon', little baldy Manc twit. Uhhh and say, "Please stay! Please stay."
Karl. Say something then! This is your last show. Say hello!
Alright
What your feelings, Karl, so far? I mean, are you cheerful, are you upset?
Not at all. Can't wait for three o'clock!
Ricky laughs
Sure.
So it was interesting how Ricky was saying he only does it for the fun. I haven't even got that bit.
Ricky laughs
I am paid peanuts to work Saturdays, wrecks me weekend.
Pay peanuts, you get monkeys.
I have no fun.
You are having a laugh!
Ricky in an annoying voice
You love this, you love this! You love me coming in and having a little chat beforehand and after!
That's the funny thing, innit? Listeners just think, why does he get so moody about it, having Ricky annoying him just on a Saturday? It's not just of a Saturday.
Why?
It's in the week as well.
How do I annoy you?
How do I annoy you, Karl? So you can't- Be specific!
Uhmmm..
See?

The first thing that springs to mind when I'm trying to work with Steve before, saying "Come on, let's find some interesting stuff to talk about". I think you were playing the accordion in me ear? Was it the accordion? It doesn't really matter, they get the idea.
Although I can't play the accordion, so it wasn't very good, was it?
Where did you find an accordion?
I just thought there was one out there. Right.
Next to the drum kit he started playing the accordion.
Then I put the accordion through the loudspeakers- loud, those loudspeakers, they're amazing!
My question is, this Karl: do you honestly think that's going to stop just because we're not on air anymore? He's not going to see you on a Saturday, so he's just going to come in even more.
Yeah, I can just drop it.
Won't bother me as much, though.
I think he will.
And I'll have his fob taken off him, so he won't be able to just wander in.
Of course I won't.
Do you think? Of course they're going to let Ricky Gervais walk in any time he wants.

Yeah, I might come in, might do a few trailers, might hang out with Andrew. "Hey Andrew, how's it going?" And he'll go "yeah, we have a bit of trouble. What do you think?" I'll say "lose that off the playlist! Put that one on! Sack them!"
Yeah
Yeah? Let's have a little bit of Feeder.
Feeder - Forget About Tomorrow fades in
Feeder - Forget About Tomorrow. At least we're here today, Steve.
Steve laughs
The three of us, for an hour and a half more. The last time ever, possibly. It's up to little baldy head Mancy. Karl Pilkingtod.

A number of emails, Rick. This is from Matthew Davis. I think he very much captures the mood of the email public. His email is just simply titled: "Go! In the name of God, go!" It says, "why wait till three? Why not leave immediately and stop subjecting us to this
Abject misery
Well, Karl did once when he had to get a train.
Of course, lest we forget.
So that's never happened on radio before.
But who knows? I mean, stay tuned. We might shoot off at 20 to two.
Or we might get better.
We might get better.
We might get better because we've done a bit of planning. Because I got Karl round last night
Really?
To do some planning of the show, didn't I? And so we thought
Yeah, I thought you were gonna be there, Steve.
No, I wasn't told about it.
I called him up, why, what are we doing? He said, well, you can come round and have a chat, maybe get some ideas and that tomorrow. So I said, is Steve there? Yeah, Steve, Steve will be coming.
Ricky giggles
So I go round... Close- Next to his flat. The pub couldn't be closer!
Ricky laughs
Alright?
Yeah.
Unless there was, sort of spirits and that in the lift. They couldn't have got closer. Alright? So I turn up. You're not there.
No
He's lied.
Yeah
Well, you wouldn't have come out if you just thought I was going to muck around. I had to pretend it was work, to get you out.
So you weren't there Steve?
No.
Anyway, so he says, oh, come in the flat. Got an interesting book that you'll like.
Okay.
So I think, well, that's kind of work, he's trying and that.
Yeah.

So go in thinking we're going to get some some good ideas and that from this book. Couldn't find the book. He looked for about 40 seconds. [mimicking Ricy] "Ahhh I don't know where it is. Let's come in here, let's have a wrestle!"
Ricky laughs
So I'm sat in the lounge. Sat there, just chatting to his girlfriend and that. Just chatting. He comes wandering out, in his underpants
Yeah
Yeah, well, it's comfortable, yeah?
I don't know if you were comfortable because it was sort of pulled up
Ricky giggles
Right between the crack.
Right.
Looked like... uhh... probably like a gay sumo wrestler.
Ricky bursts laughing
Yeah, yeah. And I did a little dance for you, didn't I? Cause there was MTV on. I was doing little dance.
Dancing to Elton John's new one.

And what did you say? What did you say when I was doing little dance for you in my pants pulled up? Do you remember what you said? I poured him a drink. He's in my home. I'm entertaining him. He goes: "Are you sure you're not a bender?"
Steve laughs
Is that any way to treat a host?
I think it was the right time to ask.
Ricky laughs

But we did do something-  because you got confused and you said- oh, God, it's like a child or a cat when it's confused. He went: "Steve reckons in ancient Greece, right? It was better to shag a bloke than a woman." And I went well, yeah, about the male being sort of a first class citizen.
Yeah
Much better, wasn't it? An aspiration to sleep with a beautiful man than a beautiful woman?
Women were lower class citizens, so therefore men were seen as higher class. So to have sexual relations with a man was there was no shame in that.
No
In fact it was looked upon as a good thing.

And I said, well, you know, ancient Rome. I said, even Nero, he used to be sitting his big jacuzzi and he used to get, you know, pretty boy men to go into the water and just nibble at his testicles while he was having a wash.
They didn't do that!
He did!
And he wasn't a gay fellow?
No. Well, no, I don't know about Nero, but I mean, it wasn't a case of a big delineation between what was heterosexual and what was gay. It was just, you know whatever-
So what did this fellow do then? This one who's having his little testicles-
Well, he was pretty much top boy, Nero, for a while.
He was in charge
And you did what you're told. If Caesar or
But why were people going around there? Why didn't they go "Uhh..."
No, they weren't dropping in!
It wasn't like the doors opening "I'm just gonna see what Nero's doing". It's not like when I'm popping in to see you.
Normally what would happen is you'd say "come back to my place. I got a book for you"
Ricky laughs
Yeah
You pop in, he comes out in his pants. Elton John would have been on.
You'd have probably been like a delivery boy or a stable boy or something. And you'd have pop round there and you'd have gone "Alright Nero, there's the tablet or stone you wanted" and he'd go
Ricky in a weird French accent
"Pilkington! While you are here pop under"
I don't know why he's French
What- What is that?
I don't know why he's French. "Just pop under the water and nibble at my testicles." And you'd have done it.
Because he was Nero.
I wouldn't.
You would have.
There's no way I would have done! What have I done, I've dropped a pizza off?
Ricky bursts laughing
Yeah you popped round Nero's place with a pizza
Right. I'd say "I've done me job. Right? That's not the sort of tip I wanted."
No. He would have said, get the little baldy chap to nibble at my testicles. And you'd have done it.
No I wouldn't have done it.
All speaking at once

Can I just say this, Steve? Not only would you be nibbling his testicles, you have been going mad. You'd have been noshing him just for extra. You'd have been doing everything he wanted. You'd have been going- He would have gone "I didn't ask you to do that!" You'd have been going mental. You'd have been chewing, slurping, smacking, poking.
Alright
You'd have gnawed his packet off.
Alright
Song fades in
You'd think you're eating Walker's crisps. There'd be bubbles. There'd be flu- ah it would have been horrible...
The Beatles from the soundtrack to the Yellow Submarine, actually. And that's 'Hey Bulldog'
On Xfm 104.9. Our last show, maybe. Me Ricky, Steve and little Karl. Alright, Karl?
But that book that that wasn't a fake. It wasn't like just a ruse to get you back, to show you me and dancing and pants to Elton John. It's a-
What was your girlfriend doing during that? Incidentally
I think she was just getting on with sort of like packing up sort of boxes because we were moving.
Well, she's seen it before.
And the book was- Do you remember that book that I showed you that it was 'A Man's Body, An Owner's Manual'?
Yes
And it's just loads of stats and there's one in there-
It's kind of like a Guinness Book of Records of men.
Yeah. There's one section there-
Sorry, hang on.
It's not a Guinness Book of Records of Men! That just sounds a little bit like you and I sat round your house, looking at a big book with pictures of men in it.
A big man book.
A big man.
He is a big man, isn't he? He should be on the front cover.
Yeah. It was a book more about the kind of physical body.
Exactly. Yeah. Biology and social and sex and all that sort of stuff.
But we didn't look at the sex stuff
Which is where we got the knob news for the day from. Right? This is true, right? I read that the-
*Ooooh you'll have someone's eye out! Knob News!*
Nearly forgot the jingle!
Yes
I read that the smallest ever functioning penis, right? Was under three quarters of an inch when erect.
Extraordinary.
That is bad luck, innit? And it's a micro penis, so it's perfectly, perfectly scaled down. Just a little-
Look at Karl's face!
Well, couldn't the fella have said "look, right, I'm not happy about it... so don't print it"
Ricky laughs
It's not the sort of press people want.

There wasn't a picture of him. It was anonymous. They didn't read the book and at work next day they go "look at this, Frank! What? Smallest ever penis, half an inch." He didn't go "It's me!" He just went "Yeah. Loser." You know what I mean?
You know what I mean? "Anyway, let's have a shower!" "I'm alright"
He must have had to have a little jod with a pair of tweezers.
Yeah. Presumably
Because you couldn't even get a fist- I mean, that is bad luck innit?
Was he a good looking fella or?

What would you do? Right? He invited you around and said, right, and he was like the king. And he went, oh, Karl could just come down there and just nibble it? And you've gone under the water and you about to nibble it and you come up and you go, that's tiny! Would you be disappointed or relieved?
Right.
Well, that wouldn't happen.
NO! Karl, I'm saying, if it did, would you be disappointed? Would you go,"Ah I can't even get- I don't know where to start with that" Or would you go, "oh, thank God it's not a big one!"
You've got to remember that he's the the Emperor, so you've got to do what he says, or he'll have you killed.
What would you do? Would you go, "oh, a lovely set of tackle" or "It's not as big as I wanted" Or would you secretly think, "I'm glad it's not big, because I didn't want to- because I'm not that gay"
I'm not even going to think about. Because I wouldn't do it. I know I wouldn't do it. Even back then.
Ricky laughs
"Even back then"!
When was Nero at it?
Ricky bursts laughing
Well, the Roman Empire was sort of like 2000 years.
Well, it stretched.
Yeah. Yeah.
So it's a long time ago.
Yeah.
I wouldn't do it.
You'd have to. You'd have to.
I always remember uh... We're still doing Knob News?
Yeah yeah yeah yeah
Is this some extra?
Know News Extra!
Knob News Extra, excellent.
Well, I didn't do that well at school and that- but we had biology and I didn't take much of it in. But there was one day when it was about, you know... knob news and stuff
Sure
And it was all about how blood, you know, is what makes
Engorges the erectile tissue.
Sure
Yeah. It was all about that. And there's this girl in our class called Paula, right? We're sat there watching it and she fainted.
Steve giggles
You just heard her go "Oughhh"  And she hit the floor because we were all sat on top of the desk watching this. I wasn't interested in that.
No
I wasn't looking at it and that. But Paula, right, she fell over.
Steve and Ricky laugh
And the funny thing was, right
Was it a video?

Yeah, a video of like this... blood, doing the business to this fellow's member, and she fell over, right? And everyone was like "Oh, what's up with her?" And the teacher was trying to wake her up and give her water and that. And it was really weird because then the nurse came in
Ricky continues to laugh

And this video was still playing and the nurse came in "What happened?" "Well, she's seen this" and you could hear like- then it was going onto like, sex education on the video. It was all done from start to finish.
Yeah
What happens, da da da, and by the end and she was still out cold by the time it got to like "And then they have a baby!"
Yeah.
And that is that's just reminded me

So it seems to me that that was a sex education class, she fainted when the penis got erect and when she woke up, the baby was born. That's probably what she thinks happens! She's wandering around now
And the whole class just missed out of it because they saw someone faint
She's with a bloke and he gets an action, she just goes "Ahhh no"
But that's it, she was a bit of a class tart, really, that's why
Awww, Karl, Karl, Karl Karl, Karl, Karl...
Yeah, but she was... Everyone was like "what's up with her? It's not like she's not seen it before"
But just reminded me then, weird. But anyway yeah, so I wouldn't...
You would, you would be loving it.
Anyway, let's leave Nero aside.
Yeah. The other thing in this- Should we play a record and come back? There's another interesting fact-
There is some extraordinary facts, yeah.
But we're running over.
It won't be Knob News. It won't be Knob News. It'll be all different types of news.
Alright then.
Record plays
Libertines - Don't Look Back Into The Sun on XFM 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais. With me, Steve Merchant and Karl Pilkington. For possibly the last time. Ever.

I was coming in today, Steve, and I was walking just past Shrewsbury Avenue, at the beginning of Shrewsbury Avenue, and it's got a little bit of a tramps corner going on there. And there's a couple of tramps, proper tramps, already had a few, and about sort of like 40 maybe they could be 30, they could have an hard life. They probably have. But he was going *mumbles* "Johnny's comin' to Albert's, Lez isn't going to make it.
And I was thinking they're just planning their social meeting there.
Yeah
I just think that's nice. They don't just drink by themselves.
Yeah
"What we're doing tonight?" "I thought we'd get drunk and sleep in a doorway". "We did that last night!"

But I just like the idea that they're planning it. And they got mates and they do stuff and they go "alright, how's it going?" "Well, you know how it's going." "I'm sitting next to you in a pile of piss! You know, how it's going!"
I was thinking, do you think they ever wake up before they had anything, like at 09:00 and go "Oh, I was pissed last night!"
-laughs- Yeah
"You were talking absolute rubbish." "What was I doing?" "You were just going" *mumbles*
"You're just shouting at cars, walking in the street"
"You're joking! Was I really embarrassing?"
Yeah
"You were pretty drunk"
"I tell you this, I'm never going to do that again!"
"Oh, but at least I didn't make a pass at Dirty Agnes!" "Oh, God. What did I do?" You're just going *mumbles*
Just love the idea. They have no little conversations and that.
Yeah
I imagine one of them going "I'm not coming out now, I've got no money" "Nor have we, yeah?" "I'm just going to go and dance. Just go and dance outside of McDonalds"
"I only made 18 p today"

Because I've always had a soft spot for the homeless. But you remember that time I was walking over to yours once and see, there's the homeless people there's, those ones that they try to retain a certain dignity. They won't just come up and ask you for money, they'll come up and maybe try and start a conversation-
Ohh!
Before introducing the fact
But what you despise and annoys you is that the thing they're trying to hold onto is a little bit of pride.
I know!
What would you want them to do? Just be crushed in a skip going "Just give me some money! Look at me!"

I just think, come out and say it. Come out and say it. But don't try and fool me, because sometimes I feel like I've been tricked. I get annoyed because I feel like I didn't see you coming. You came out of left field.
Sorry! I imagine the fact that they're bare chested, apart from a blanket with their hand out covered in sores and no teeth is a clue that they're-

This was one of those ones- you sometimes see them, the ones that are slightly older and they've got a full suit on. They wear a complete suit, like a pinstripe suit or something, with maybe trainers, admittedly
Yeah

And I sort of think to myself, at what point in that moment before they finally left the house for the last time did they think, well, I'm going to be homeless. I want to look good if I'm going to be homeless, I'm sleeping rough.
But it does happen quickly.
It can happen in a matter of days or weeks.
Anyway, listen, I don't I'm not begrudging the fact that he asked for money. That's fine. I just felt a little bit annoyed because I thought he was an ordinary person
Right
And he came up to me and he said to me
Nice distinction, go on

And he said to me, "Excuse me mate, have you got the time?" and I said, whatever, ten past three. And he went "have you got any money?" And I knew now, I was annoyed and it annoyed me because I thought I should have known straight away. I mean, a homeless person, I sensed it, sensed it straight away. "Excuse me, have you got the time?" I wanted to say to him "Where have you got to be?"
Well, yeah
What appointments have you got?

Well, no, maybe, he goes to work, he starts begging at 03:00, he asked all that day he goes, what time? They go Quarter to four or whatever, you know what I mean? Then he goes "oh, give us some money, it's 03:00!"
Right
Maybe there's the mornings off. It might have been his day off, he was doing half day off or shift work, you know what I mean? You never know what shift they're on.

I just think when you see those people from shelter or from famine relief in the street, they got to wear those kind of those little things over their clothes that say where they're from or at least some kind of name tag. So you know when you're stopped by them, you know what to expect. They got a clipboard.
I know

These homeless people who come out and they look like regular people. They come lurching out like zombies. You go "Oh, that's an attractive woman" She's just come over... Oh no, look, she's got a dog on a piece of string.
I know, yeah.
I just think they've got to come out with it, they should just come out. Just be honest, be proud.

Those people with a thing sometimes annoy me is where they stand right in the middle of the pavement. I have to zigzag, I have to cross the road four times to get through them. It's like playing Getaway on video, avoiding all these up and down Oxford Street. You have to really- come out
It's the worst when they recognize me. That's why I've got about eight standing orders now where I've been caught.
I leave the house, and it's just like people are trying to take my money from me.
Ricky laughs
Between my house and the tube, there's just swarms of people trying to take my money from me at any cost.
Karl's got his first little direct debit, haven't you now? Five quid a week or five quid a month?
Yeah, I've joined some something to help Africa about. I quizzed her for a bit. I mean, she came over and she was saying
He was talking to her for about 40 minutes.
Just making sure your money was going to the right place.
Yeah

I was saying, you know, why have I got to give you me bank details? This is the thing. And I was saying to her, I'm sure you'd make more money, right, if you just had the little thing that you put money in. I said, I want to help you out, right? But it's the fact I've got to give you bank details. And she's saying, no, this is the way we guarantee we make money and we can help places out because, we could be out all day and we could only earn, like, 50p, whereas we know that it's worth us standing around. So I was like, well, fair enough. So what's my money going to be doing then? And I think it's called Care of the World or something. And she's saying, we're giving them money to buy hammers.
And we're not just going to give them money to blow in and stuff. They've got to like, work and
They don't give them money! What do you think of these people- Just like these drought planes.
There's a gift voucher for B&Q. So they have to buy a hammer.
They go with the buckets and go and they throw it up and they go "bundle!"

She was making out anyway, right? She was nice enough. She was selling it to me. She said "we give them the tools and they feel good because they're building up their own place and everything" and I said fair enough. And now I've done that for two months. They've got a tenner off me already. I'm checking it, making sure they're not ripping me off and that. If I ever go to Africa and I need a hammer and there isn't one...
Yeah
I'll be livid.
You'll be livid
Because it is a lot of money
Sure
For every month a fiver.
And you know, you're talking about people hassling you and that in the street. I actually moved flat- the last flat I lived in, I moved from there because of the hassle.
Really?
Yeah, it was a high street and you couldn't- like, you were saying, you nip out for a loaf and spend about 40 quid.
Ricky giggles
Yeah.
Just just on people saying, give us money, tramps, heart attacks, old people or whatever. It's like, yeah. Ended up pushing me off that street. No, I can't handle this.
It's it's getting crazy out there. They may as well have those little stalls.
Yeah.
Hey, but listen, let's make the world a better place with a little bit of music. Bit of Bauhaus?
Yeah.
Give generous people, come on

Bauhaus's version of David Bowie's 'Ziggy Stardust' on Xfm 104.9. I'm Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington. Possibly for the last time. And as a special treat, a return, sort of like a summer special, an end of term, well a gift to the fans: Karl is bringing back Rockbusters.
Steve sighs annoyed
D'ya want to explain it?

Rockbusters is basically Blockbusters, completely ripped off, done with music, that may or may not be a cryptic clue and may or may not be the actual bad name, and may or may not be the actual letters he said they were in the first place.
Do you want to sort of describe one, though, in case someone's a new listener?
Well... Exploding pet was Atomic Kitten. AK.

But basically, for those of you who are new to the show, this is the final show. Karl reads out what he considers to be a cryptic clue. It's not cryptic clue. It's just some words. Just a string of words. And from that you are supposed to deduct the name of an artist or a group or a band.
We've had things like the "Jamaican fella swinging a fish round. That was Detrout Spinners.
Detrout Spinners.
So that's the sort of-, that's the level of intellect you are getting from Karl Pilkington.
What was the one
Just do the competition!
I was thinking was it she fell down in Texas?
Wet Knee Houston.
She fell down into a puddle
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
[~3 mins of missing transcription]
